availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To His Excellency Beriah Magoffin
Governor of Kentucky

Your Petitioner John Mulcay states that the November Term (1860) of the city court of Louisville, he was fine a six months imprisonment, in the county Jail of Jefferson County & also fined in the same case twenty five dollars -- upon an Indictment for interferring with a Policeman, when arresting one Timothy Griffin, The Jury in the verdict recommended him to Executive Clemency -- after deliberating for some time on the case in their retirement -- He asks that Your excellency to remit the aforesaid imprisonment and fine & he will Ever pray & Mulcay is now confined in Jail

Remitted as to imprisonment
B. M.

Louisville Cty Ct
$25. & 6 mos. Impt
John Mulcay
Issd Nov 13. 1860
